column4: anyone know why i can't bind any programs to ANY ports (+ or - 1026)
anyone know why i can't bind any programs to ANY ports (+ or - 1026)???
anyone know why i can't bind any programs to ANY ports (+ or - 1026)?
you should be able to >=1024, how are you trying?
hmm, i would go through these files to see if anything's out of order - /var/log/{dmesg,debug,syslog}
everything looks fine in the logs
any other suggestions?

it takes time trawling through those files and you need to put on your 'scrutiny' goggles before examining them .. small things do count, apart from that all i can suggest is having a look on launchpad if someone else might have experienced the same thing
its on a server, so its a bad thing if its down for long
i guess i'll have to reinstall the OS when i get the time, i wish ubuntu was a little more stable, i would hate to go back to debian
have you got any iptables rules in place?
i was thinking it was a networking problem
how did this condition come to be? i'm assuming it was all working fine at some point .
the sudo /etc/init.d/networking start fails to start
yes, i restart my computer
what happens when you manually try and bring the interfaces up?
the error in the /etc/init.d/networking start gives me errors with ifup and ifdown
so i am assuming i can't start/stop them manually (atheros at ath0)
you make too many assumptions -- try it manually .. and pastebin the errors you get
does that error message give you any ideas what could cause that problem?
looks like you have a malformatted or missing interfaces file? check if it exists and if you can .. please put it in a pastebin for us to see
there we go, i fixed it by removing my bluetooth network
let me see if i can bind now
no, i still can't bind, but at least i can /etc/init.d/network restart successfully
